text: Benedictine Monastery of the Holy Trinity () is a Benedictine monastery in Las Condes, Santiago Province, Chile noted for its modernist architecture. == Architecture == The monastery was designed by Martín Correa Prieto and Gabriel Guarda in 1961 and constructed from 1962 to 1964. In designing the building, Prieto and Guarda focused on the manipulation of light.
